intro: Deyeuxia macgregorii, commonly known as the MacGregor's sedge, is a perennial grass species native to parts of Australia. It typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, often found in the Northern Territory and Queensland. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is part of the Cyperaceae family. Deyeuxia macgregorii is adapted to tolerate waterlogged conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
